metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NC DENR, Division of Waste Management, Hazardous Waste Section
North Carolina Division of Waste Management Hazardous Waste Section

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This data set represents the location of sites within North Carolina that are regulated by the hazardous waste portions of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA). This includes Large Quantity Generators, Small Quantity Generators, Transporters of Hazardous Waste, permitted treatment, storage or disposal (TSD) facilities and TSD facilities that are under an Order or a Consent Agreement. (Note: facilities that are Conditionally Exempt Small Quantity Generators may also be included if they are also a Transporter or TSD facility.) The data is extracted from the EPA RCRAInfo database. The State of North Carolina, Division of Waste Management, Hazardous Waste Section is the implementer of record for this data. The Hazardous Waste Section is authorized by EPA to administer the hazardous waste program.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: The purpose of this data set is to provide a geographic representation of the location of all active hazardous waste sites as regulated by the NC Hazardous Waste Section. This dataset is intended for general planning and mapping purposes (rather than highly accurate analytical or public health purposes).

credit.gco:CharacterString: Division of Waste Management, Hazardous Waste Section; Division of Waste Management GIS

keyword.gco:CharacterString: North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources
North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources
North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources
North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources
North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the Division of Waste Management would be appreciated.

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Where indicated, the location of the facilities is based on geocoding of address information that is submitted when a facility requests an EPA Identification number (EPA ID). The EPA ID is a location based number and it does not travel with the facility.

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
All sites regulated by the hazardous waste sections of RCRA and within North Carolina are represented as of the date of currentness

Refer to in-line metadata for details on location methodology for each feature. Address information and accuracy varies. However, the relative accuracies of information may be qualified as follows: The accuracy of information for the Treatment, Storage and Land Unit facilities is very high; The accuracy of information for Large Quantity Generators is high; The accuracy of information for Transporters is high; The accuracy of information for Small Quantity Generators is medium.

description.gco:CharacterString: Project data to NAD 1983 using "NAD 1983 to WGS 1984 1" geographic transformation method
Geocode data and produce X/Y GIS layer
Overwrite geo-coded (address-matched) locations for TSDs with online mapping verified coordinates
